title: jerry0
author: jerry0
content: With the old nano ledger s, the cable that came with it, you connect it to a usb a port on your laptop. With the nano ledger s plus, is that the same cable that comes a long with it?  So the cable would connect to a usb a port on your laptop? Or is that cable connect to a usb c port?  Heard more devices are connecting via usb c as oppose to usb a so wanted to know what the other end of the cable for the nano ledger s is connected to.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: jerry0 on April 30, 2023, 04:42:44 PMSo the cable would connect to a usb a port on your laptop?If we look at Ledger's site we read:Quote from: https://shop.ledger.com/products/ledger-nano-s-plusBox contents1 hardware wallet, 1 USB-C to USB-A cable, 1 getting started leaflet, 3 recovery sheets, 1 keychain strapIf we Google for USB A port we find out how it looks like: it's the usual USB port from your laptop.However, a Ledger Nano S/S plus should work with any data cable with the right plugs. At least mine does.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: NeuroticFish on April 30, 2023, 04:52:03 PMQuote from: jerry0 on April 30, 2023, 04:42:44 PMSo the cable would connect to a usb a port on your laptop?If we look at Ledger's site we read:Quote from: https://shop.ledger.com/products/ledger-nano-s-plusBox contents1 hardware wallet, 1 USB-C to USB-A cable, 1 getting started leaflet, 3 recovery sheets, 1 keychain strapIf we Google for USB A port we find out how it looks like: it's the usual USB port from your laptop.However, a Ledger Nano S/S plus should work with any data cable with the right plugs. At least mine does.jerry0 will always be jerry0: Nano Ledger S Plus Cable?

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: Charles-Tim on April 30, 2023, 05:00:03 PMNano Ledger S Plus Cable?Sadly this also shows how badly I also start forgetting lately
